channel.title: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!
channel.description:
Jagex a.k.a. founders of RuneScape have updated there server files when they updated Cache 510 to 511. They even changed there CopyRight statement. So all you people that don't know to either play a server below 510 or don't because you don't thinks its legal, now you know.
Any sauce on this; it seem legit?

item.title: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!
item.dc:creator: @Zorlin Zorlin
item.description:
@Zorlin wrote:

Mopman:

Was a bit sarcastic really, the point is that there is absolutely no way taking somebody elses app (free [gratis] or not), editing it, and then giving it away to other people is legal

unless its properly licensed under something like the GNU General Public License in which case such acts are encouraged.

Read full topic
item.source: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!

item.title: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Mopman:

It dosen’t matter whether you gain advantage or not, though

My point is that if you give out someone else materials you in most cases get an advantage.

But there is one way, get the owners permission.

Read full topic
item.source: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!

item.title: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!

It dosen’t matter whether you gain advantage or not, though

item.source: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!

item.title: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Mopman:

Was a bit sarcastic really, the point is that there is absolutely no way taking somebody elses app (free [gratis] or not), editing it, and then giving it away to other people is legal

The reason is that you can’t get an advantage of others work without paying for it.

Like making a page with free cache download and modified clients and earn money on advisements. Then you are taking away money from Jagex since they could get the money by only let people download it from their site.

Read full topic
item.source: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!

item.title: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!

item.source: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!

item.title: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:8, topic:283828”]Distributing the client/cache is definitely illegal. That goes for UK and US, no idea about other countries.

Just because something is given to you for free does not give you the right to give to others for free, law is weird like that.[/quote]
What’s so weird about it? It’s to protect the rights of the initial creator to ensure that they can receive revenue for their work.
Not that most people give a shit about the rights of people and companies that are already so rich it isn’t funny.

Read full topic
item.source: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!

item.title: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Distributing the client/cache is definitely illegal. That goes for UK and US, no idea about other countries.

Just because something is given to you for free does not give you the right to give to others for free, law is weird like that.

Read full topic
item.source: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!

item.title: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:6, topic:283828”]Isn’t the cache put on our computers by them anyways? O_o

We’re not allowed to use what they give us?[/quote]

Now you see, this is where it gets complicated, I have no intention of paying a small fee to check the legal status of it in the UK, but, if anything, distributing the cache while making money from using the cache(that is, through ad revenue, donations or membership or whatever), the client or anything runescape related is probably illegal

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Fat Cookies:

Its been in the Terms of Service

Which isn’t legally binding.

The only thing I can imagine you could possibly get in trouble for is distributing the client/cache.

[quote=“eczema3, post:3, topic:283828”]I heard that the servers are actually legal, because its our own work, but the clients that are used to play the servers aren’t because we stole them. ;[[/quote]We’re using their protocol.

Read full topic

item.title: Aparrently Private Servers above 510 cache are illegal? Good move Jagex!
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

All private servers include modified/reverse engineered clients are “illegal” so it really does not matter what version your using. Its been in the Terms of Service since day one and you cannot change your copyright statement to ban use of the cache because there’s nothing wrong with that.

Rsbot.org iis full of weird stuff… Sause?

Read full topic
